PlantForm: Perennial or annual herb or small shrub.
Stem: Woody, branching several times, round, fibrous, covered in fine hairs.
Leaves: Lance shaped with serrated edges, alternately arranged on stem.
Flowers: Yellow, usually singular sometimes in pairs.
FruitSeeds: Hard structure that goes from green to brown as matures, sometimes in clusters, breaking apart into 8-10 wedge shaped seeds.
DistinguishingFeatures: Very similar to other Sida species, distinguished from Malvastrum species by having an epicalyx (second layer of bracts below flower).
